summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons Inmate Personal Property Record (Form BP-A0383) for an inmate, likely Jeffrey Epstein, documenting the disposition of his personal property upon his release from a hospital or medical unit. The form indicates property was returned to the inmate, with a signature from a releasing officer and the inmate.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose personal property is being inventoried and released, as indicated by the form's purpose and the inmate's signature section.

persons.name: D. Special
persons.context: The officer who examined and released the inmate's property, as signed in the 'Printed Name/Signature of Releasing Officer' field.

connections.description: Officer D. Special processed and released inmate Jeffrey Epstein's personal property upon his release from custody or a hospital unit.

events.title: Inmate Property Release
events.description: An inmate's personal property was inventoried and released back to them upon their release from a hospital or medical unit, as documented on a Bureau of Prisons form.

keyFacts: The document is a standardized Bureau of Prisons form (BP-A0383) for recording the disposition of an inmate's personal property.
The form is dated July 5, 2019, which is shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019, suggesting it relates to a prior release from custody or a medical hold.
The property was returned to the inmate ('Returned to Inmate'), not donated or stored, indicating a release event.
The form includes a detailed inventory of personal items including clothing, toiletries, food, and legal materials.
Both a releasing officer (D. Special) and the inmate certified the receipt and condition of the property.
